attributes.action: Cancel the £9,000 tuition fees + Cancel all Uni exams and assignments
attributes.additional_details:
If GCSE and A Level students don't have to take their exams, why should Uni students.
Its a disgrace that Uni students are getting treated so poorly throughout the COVID 19 pandemic and they still expect Uni students to still down and be quiet.
Enough is enough. Change is needed
attributes.background:
Government should cancel or reduce the £9,000 tuition fees for all Uni students across the UK.
Also, cancel all and any remaining exams and/or assignments for uni students

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Require universities to partially refund tuition fees for 20/21 due to Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324762

Lower university tuition fees for students until online teaching ends: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552911

Refund ALL University student tuition fees due to lack of quality in education: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555516

Reduce student loan debts by the cost of all tuition fees paid during Covid-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560953

Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.
